Fact Check: Now JD(U) leader falls for best national anthem hoax

India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found JDU leader Ajay Alok's claim that Jana Mana Gana has been declared best national anthem by Unesco to be false. This false claim has been viral on Internet for years.

Claim:
UNESCO has declared Indian national anthem as the best in the world.

Fact:
It's a hoax. UNESCO has not announced any such award.

Detailed Explanation:
Janata Dal (United) leader Ajay Alok is the latest to fall for the age-old hoax that Unesco has declared 'Jana Gana Mana' as the best national anthem in the world.

On Saturday, he made a tweet in Hindi which claimed that Unesco has recently declared the Indian national anthem as the best in the world. The tweet was liked by more than 23,000 users and retweeted almost 4,500 times.

This false message has been circulating since 2008. When India Today contacted Unesco for clarification at that time, a representative categorically denied that any such award was announced by them.

In March this year, Factly also debunked this fake news. They found a document on the Unesco website which discussed this viral message and clearly stated that the message is a famous rumour.

The Indian Express had also listed this viral message as one of the most popular fake news of 2016.

After being pointed out that it's a hoax, Ajay Alok responded that even if the news being circulated on WhatsApp is fake, it gives him happiness and spiritual satisfaction because it has led the world to discuss India's national anthem.

Conclusion: The claim is FALSE. UNESCO has not declared India's national anthem as the best in the world.
